weka.filters.unsupervised.attribute

Class SubstringReplacer

  • java.lang.Object
    • weka.filters.Filter
      • weka.filters.SimpleFilter
        • weka.filters.SimpleStreamFilter
          • weka.filters.unsupervised.attribute.SubstringReplacer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, weka.core.CapabilitiesHandler, weka.core.CapabilitiesIgnorer, weka.core.CommandlineRunnable, weka.core.OptionHandler, weka.core.Preconstructed, weka.core.RevisionHandler, weka.filters.PreconstructedFilter, weka.filters.StreamableFilter

    @KFIgnore
public class SubstringReplacer
extends weka.filters.SimpleStreamFilter
implements weka.filters.PreconstructedFilter
    A filter that can replace substrings in the values of string attributes. Multiple match and replace "rules" can be specified - these get applied in the order that they are defined. Each rule can be applied to one or more user-specified input String attributes. Attributes can be specified using either a range list (e.g 1,2-10,last) or by a comma separated list of attribute names (where "/first" and "/last" are special strings indicating the first and last attribute respectively). This filter is intended to be used in a purely streaming fashion - i.e where each instance is transformed, processed and then discarded. This is because it limits the number of string values kept in memory (in the header) for a particular attribute to exactly 1, i.e. the value of the current instance being processed.
    Version:
    $Revision: $
    Author:
    Mark Hall (mhall{[at]}pentaho{[dot]}com)
    See Also:
